title: Sentinel-1C fuelled ahead of liftoff
summary: Marking a major milestone in the preparation of Copernicus Sentinel-1C for its scheduled 3 December liftoff, experts have completed the critical and hazardous process of fuelling the satellite.

title: The Exploration Company raises $160 million for Nyx cargo vehicle
summary: The Exploration Company has raised $160 million to support the company’s development of a cargo spacecraft to support future commercial space stations.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 20 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from California
summary: The launch from Vandenberg Space Force Base includes 13 Starlink satellites that include Direct to Cell capabilities. Liftoff from pad 4E is set for 9:47 p.m. PST (12:47 a.m. EST, 0547 UTC).

title: New study reveals Starship’s true sound levels; shows differences between SLS and Falcon 9
summary: When SpaceX launched Starship and Super Heavy for its first flight test in April 2023, the rocket became the most powerful ever flown, mostly due in part to Super Heavy’s 33 Raptor engines. As such, Starship is loud — extremely loud, and scientists and government agencies have long discussed the potential environmental impacts from a launch cadence that sees Starship launch hundreds of times in one year.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy November 17-24, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of November 17-24, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session...

title: The Exploration Company Raises $160M in New Funding
summary: The Exploration Company announced on 17 November that it had raised $160 million (€151.6 million) in Series B funding to continue the development of its Nyx spacecraft. The company has now raised nearly $230 million. Founded in 2021, The Exploration Company is developing Nyx, a reusable modular spacecraft that will be used to deliver cargo […]

title: SpaceX launches mystery ‘Optus-X’ on Falcon 9 rocket from the Kennedy Space Center
summary: The launch has been shrouded in secrecy and is being referred as the “TD7 mission” by SpaceX. Liftoff from Launch Complex 39A happened Sunday, Nov. 17, at 5:28 p.m. EST (2228 UTC).

title: AST SpaceMobile secures multi-launch agreements with Blue Origin, ISRO and SpaceX
summary: A batch of rockets will support sending up to about 60 of AST SpaceMobile’s Block 2 BlueBird satellites to orbit. The company’s goal is to establish a space-based cellular broadband network.

title: Space Force taps OpTech for $4.5 million optical sensor payload
summary: The imaging payload will be deployed on an Impulse Space vehicle for the Space Force’s Victus Surgo mission scheduled for 2026

title: Two Senate Space Leaders Call for Investigation into Musk-Putin Relationship
summary: Two Democratic Senators with considerable influence over space program policy and spending are urging an investigation into reports that Elon Musk is in contact with Russian President Vladimir Putin despite...
